item.title: How I Built My Minimal Blog Website
item.description:
Creating a blog from scratch isn’t just about putting up posts — it’s about building a space that feels like you. One that’s easy to maintain, fast to load, SEO-friendly, and aesthetic enough that you’re proud to share it.

This is a detailed breakdown of how I built my own personal blog, from a blank screen to a deployed site — and every hurdle I crossed along the way.

item.title: How I Built My Portfolio Website Using Lovable
item.description:
Ever since I stepped into tech, I’ve had this idea lingering in the back of my mind — to create a space online that truly feels like me. Not just a bunch of links or text, but a reflection of my work, thoughts, and energy. So, I finally sat down, spent some focused time, and built my own personal portfolio website: Anson Jaison | Portfolio.

And this is the full story — everything from tools and design decisions to random bugs and late-night “why isn’t this loading” moments.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
I’m not sure who will read this. Maybe someone from my family, maybe a friend, or maybe even someone I haven’t met yet.
This is just a small space I’ve decided to create — for writing, reflecting, and sharing what I learn along the way.

To be honest, I’m not very used to writing about myself. It feels a bit awkward. But since this is the first post, I thought I’d quietly introduce myself — just so there’s a starting point.
